comments:
I have a toolgroup in the palette. Inside this group I have creation tools and separators. When trying to get generate the gmf gen I am getting the following exception:

java.lang.ClassCastException: org.eclipse.gmf.codegen.gmfgen.impl.SeparatorImpl incompatible with org.eclipse.gmf.codegen.gmfgen.ToolEntry
at org.eclipse.gmf.internal.bridge.tooldef.PaletteHandler.findToolEntry(PaletteHandler.java:158)
at org.eclipse.gmf.internal.bridge.tooldef.PaletteHandler.toToolEntry(PaletteHandler.java:141)
at org.eclipse.gmf.internal.bridge.tooldef.PaletteHandler.process(PaletteHandler.java:118)
at org.eclipse.gmf.internal.bridge.genmodel.DiagramGenModelTransformer.process(DiagramGenModelTransformer.java:245)
at org.eclipse.gmf.internal.bridge.genmodel.MappingTransformer.transform(MappingTransformer.java:32)
at org.eclipse.gmf.internal.codegen.popup.actions.TransformToGenModel$1.transform(TransformToGenModel.java:189)
at org.eclipse.gmf.internal.codegen.popup.actions.TransformToGenModel$1.run(TransformToGenModel.java:159)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:58)

I feel this happens because one of NodeMapping reference incorrect tool from the .gmftool. This could happen e.g. if .gmftool was modified and order of tools has changed, while .gmfmap was not updated. We rely on EMF references there, which are index-based.
Please reopen if the problem persists.
